loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora. María P. es socia del banco comunal Corazones de Turi, vive en la comunidad Corazón de Jesús en la parroquia de Turi, este lugar es admirado por ser el mirador de la ciudad, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura.

Doña María tiene 52 años, es casada y tiene 9 hijos, su primer hijo es casado y vive independientemente al igual que sus 4 hijos siguientes, sus  hijos que viven en su hogar son  de 19, 18, 15 y 11 años de edad, sus hijos de 19 y 18 trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su hijo de 15 estudia en el colegio y su ultimo hijo en la escuela. Su esposo labora como albañil y con el trabajo conyugal han construido su casa propia.

Doña María se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar en donde cría animales como: cuyes, pollos, cerdos y ganado  que los vende en su comunidad, los pollos que cría los vende por entregas.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y  lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento. Su meta es crecer en el negocio y realizar un galpón más grande para tener sus pollos.
texts.en:
Ms. María P. is a member of the Community Bank "Corazones de Turi". She lives in the Corazón de Jesús community in the parish of Turi. This place is admired for being the viewpoint of the city, where people work in commerce, raising animals and agriculture. 

María is 52 years old, married and has 9 children. Her eldest is married and lives on his own as do his 4 sequential siblings. Their children that live at home are 19, 18, 15, and 11 years old. The 19 and 18 year old work and help with expenses. The 15 year old studies at the university and the youngest is in school. Her husband works as a bricklayer and with their combined efforts they have built their own house. María works around the house and raises the animals such as: guinea pigs, chickens, pigs and cattle that she sells in their community. The chicken she raises she sells in installments.

This is her second loan she has gotten in the Community Bank and she is going to invest it in buying more chicken and feed. Her goal is to expand the business and get a larger shed to keep her chickens.

loans.use: Buy feed for animals and chickens.

loans.name: Las Marías De Monte Salas Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en la casa de Verónica S., un integrante del grupo Las Marías de Monte Salas, que está ubicado en el Estado de Veracruz en México. Ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos que inicio hace 2 años. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en mercancía. Sus clientes la consideran una persona honesta y responsable, en quien se puede confiar. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente satisfecha por poder reinvertir en su negocio. Tiene 31 años, estudio hasta la secundaria, está casada y tiene en total 2 hijos; 1 mujer y 1 varón. Quiere este crédito para incrementar sus ganancias. También espera  poder ahorrar y darle una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: This photo was taken in the home of Verónica S., a member of the "Las Marías de Monte Salas" ["The Marías of Monte Salas"] Group, which is located in the state of Veracruz in Mexico. Verónica sells shoes, which she started doing two years ago. She is requesting this loan to invest in merchandise. Her customers consider her to be a very honest and responsible woman in whom they can trust. As she is requesting this loan, she feels happy that she will be able to reinvest in her business. She is 31 years old, studied until secondary school, and is married with two children (one girl and one boy). She would like to use this loan to increase her earnings. She also hopes to be able to save and to provide her children with a better education.

loans.use: to invest in her shoe business

loans.name: Union De Mujeres En Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
Josefa es la coordinadora del grupo Union de mujeres en desarrollo, Grupo formado por 10 mujeres empresarias, dominico-haitianas de la ciudad de San Pedro de Macoris, viven en una comunidad de escasos recursos, rural bordeada por los campos de plantacion de caña de azucar. Se dedican mayormente a la venta de alimentos, comida, Ropa, Calzados, Accesorios, cosméticos, alimentos, entre otros productos misceláneos.

Josefa, es una madre haitiana de 3 hijos, la cual ha emigrado a Republica Dominicana, con la esperanza de lograr un mejor futuro para ella y sus hijos; ha sido dificil establecerse, y formar un negocio, muchas veces por la falta de capital, da gracias a que el programa de Esperanza llego a su comunidad y va a poder invertir y mejorar en su negocio, por medio de este podra tambien ayudar y proveer sus necesidades y la de sus hijos. Sueña con regresar a Haiti y tener una vida estable y segura.

Josefa se dedica a la venta de ropa interior, esta recibiendo su primer prestamo con Esperanza y sus planes de inversion son cobrar todo su prestamo en mercancias para poder expandir sus clientes y poder expandirse.

Su historia representa a los demás miembros de su grupo y a los clientes de Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia la República Dominicana desde Haití, algunos de ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas de escasos recursos en la República Dominicana, carecen de agua potable y energía eléctrica constante.
texts.en:
Josefa is the coordinator of the "Unión de Mujeres en Desarrollo" (Union of Developing Women) group which is made up of 10 Dominico-Haitian businesswomen from the city of San Pedro de Macoris.  The women live in a poor, rural community which is surrounded by fields of sugar cane.  The women mainly work selling food, meals, clothes, shoes, accessories, cosmetics and other miscellaneous products. 

Josefa is a Haitian mother who has three children.  She emigrated to the Dominican Republic with the hope of achieving a better future for herself and her children.  It has been difficult for her to get established and set up a business, often owing to the lack of capital.  She is thankful that Esperanza's program reached her community and that she is going to be able to invest in and improve her business.  Through her business she will be able to cover her needs and those of her children.  She dreams of returning to Haiti and living a stable and safe life.

Josefa's business is selling underwear.  She is receiving her first loan from Esperanza and she plans to invest all her loan money in buying merchandise so that she can increase her number of customers and expand her business.

Josefa's story is representative of the other members of her group and Esperanza's clients in general, both the Haitians (many of whom have recently emigrated to the Domincan Republic from Haiti) and the Dominicans.  In general they live in very poor communities.  This area, in common with many other poor areas in the Dominican Republic, lacks reliable supplies of drinking water and electricity.

loans.use: Clothes

loans.name: María Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora. María D. es socia del banco comunal Corazones de Turi, vive en la comunidad  Corazón de Jesús en la parroquia de Turi, este lugar es admirado por ser el mirador de la ciudad, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura.

La Señora. María tiene 47 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 26, 23, 13 y 12 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven  independientes, su hija de 13 años ayuda en la casa y estudia a distancia, su hijo de 12 años por falta de recursos económicos no pudo ingresar al colegio. Su esposo labora como albañil y con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña María se ocupa de los quehaceres de su hogar en donde se dedica a la agricultura, ella siembra hortalizas y cría  animales como: cuyes y pollos los que vende en la ciudad de Cuenca o en su comunidad.

Se encuentra en el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de mas pollos para continuar en esta actividad. Su meta es llegar a tener un criadero de pollos más grande.
texts.en:
María D. is a member of the Corazones de Turi ("Turi Hearts") community bank. She lives in the Corazón de Jesús community in the parish of Turi. The place is admired for being the viewpoint of the city, and its people work in trade, animal husbandry and agriculture. 

María is 47 years old and married with four children, aged 26, 23, 13 and 12 years old. Her two eldest children are married and live independently. Her 13 year old daughter helps at home and is distance learning. Her 12 year old son could not start secondary school due to their lack of funds. Her husband works as a builder and with both their effort they have managed to build their own home.

María takes care of the household chores and works in agriculture. She grows vegetables and raises animals such as guinea pigs and chickens, which she sells in the city of Cuenca or in her community. 

This is her third loan cycle with the communal bank, and she plans to invest it in the purchase of more chickens to continue her business. Her goal is to have a bigger chicken farm.

loans.use: Buy chickens.

loans.name: Princesas De Cuautlapan Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en el negocio de la señorita Guadalupe Fidelia R., un integrante del grupo Las Princesas de Cuautlapan, que esta ubicado en el Estado de VeraC., en México. Ella se dedica a la venta de Papeleria y merceria que inicio hace 1 año. Solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercancía y tener surtido su negocio para incrementar sus ventas, además de dedicarse a la organización de eventos sociales. Sus compañeros, vecinos y clientes la conocen como una persona trabajadora y responsable. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente satisfecha ya que por medio de este crédito podra incrementar sus ventas. Tiene 42 años, estudio hasta el bachillerato y es soltera. También espera seguir ayudando a sus padres y apoyarlos con los gastos de la casa ya que vive con ellos.
texts.en: This photo was taken at the business of Ms. Guadalupe Fidelia R., a member of the group "Las Princesas of Cuautlapan" ["The Princesses of Cuautlapan"], which is located in the Mexican state of VeraC.. Guadalupe sells stationery and other merchandise, which she started doing one year ago. She is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise and to stock her business in order to increase her sales, as well as to work planning social events. Her friends, neighbors, and customers know her as a hard-working and responsible woman. As she requests this loan, she feels happy that this will make it possible for her to increase her sales. She is 42 years old, finished high school, and is single. She also hopes to continue helping her parents with the expenses for the home where they live together.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her paper store

loans.name: Carmen Guadalupe

texts.es:
La Señora. Carmen Z. es socia del banco comunal Corazones de Turi, vive en la comunidad  Corazón de Jesús en la parroquia de Turi, este lugar es admirado por ser el mirador de la ciudad, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura.

Doña Carmen tiene 22 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos quienes se encuentran de 4 y 2 años de edad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en una casa que le presta su mamá.

La Señora. Carmen labora como empleada domestica desde hace 2 meses, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde, pero ella no deja de trabajar ya que en su casa cría  animales como: cerdos y pollos a los que vende en las ferias de la ciudad.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de más animales. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Carmen Z. is a member of the Corazones de Turi ("Turi Hearts") communal bank. She lives in the Corazón de Jesús community in the parish of Turi. The place is admired for being a viewpoint of the city and its people work in trade, animal husbandry and agriculture.

Carmen, 22, is a single mother with two children aged 4 and 2 years old. She does not have her own house and lives in one lent by her mother. 

Carmen has been working as housekeeper for two months, from 9 am to 3 pm, Monday to Friday. But she never stops working because at home she breeds animals such as pigs and chickens that she sells in fairs in the city. 

This is her second loan with the community bank and she is going to invest it in the purchase of more animals. Her goal is to own her own house.

loans.use: Buy pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es: Pedro José, cuenta con su negocio que es una pulpería. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos por lo que se siente muy contento. Su actividad está ubicada en su vivienda. La mayoría de sus clientes llegan a solicitar diferentes productos, por lo que se siente muy contento de ofrecer este medio de vida. El solicita este crédito para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, pan entre otros productos que le solicitan.
texts.en:
Pedro José's business is a small grocery store.  This is not the first time that he has taken out a loan and he feels very happy.  His business is located in his home.  His customers come to him and request different products.  He is very happy to be in this line of work.

Pedro José is requesting this loan to buy basic grains, candies, soft drinks, bread and other products that his customers are asking him for.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
el grupo la Amistad esta integrado por 3 mujeres muy trabajadoras y unidas, todas residen en el barrio Abajo de la ciudad de Danli,  a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

la sra. Karla Judith A. es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de joyas elaboradas de plata, actividad que tiene (3) tres años de haber iniciado.
Doña Karla vende su producto de manera ambulante en diferentes empresas como ser: fábricas de puros y en algunas oficinas publicas y privadas,  la mayor parte de las ventas son al crédito por lo que destina un día a la semana para cobrar.
Doña Karla cuenta con una gran clientela y esto es debido a que sus joyas son de muy buena calidad, ofrece un gran surtido y varias facilidades de pagos a sus clientes.
Doña Karla es madre soltera de una hermosa niña, la que en la actualidad es pasante de educación primaria en una escuela de la localidad,  todo esto debido al esfuerzo de doña Karla para salir adelante con su hija.

la sra. Dominga Ceneno P. es comerciante y su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotaría tiene una pulperia la cual opera bajo el nombre de pulpería “La Bendición”,  cuenta con mas de un año de experiencia en la administración del mismo y es notable que durante este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar, su negocio luce muy bien surtido, sus condiciones de vida se ven favorables.
doña Minga como es mas conocida en su barrio cuenta con una gran clientela ya que su negocio se encuentra ubicado en una zona de talleres y otros negocios, por lo que hay mucho movimiento de personas.
Doña Minga convive en unión libre y han procreado 2 hijos de los cuales el mayor es totalmente independiente y el menor esta en una escuela primaria de la localidad.

la sra. Delfina Antonia C. es comerciante y su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotaría, actividad en la que cuenta con mas de 5 cinco años de experiencia en la administración del mismo y su negocio opera bajo el nombre de pulpería “Roció”.
Doña Delfina cuenta con una gran clientela y esto es debido a la ubicación estratégica de su negocio.
Doña Delfina es viuda y madre de tres hijos, los cuales son mayores de edad y todos son completamente independientes.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia y surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
The “La Amistad” (Friendship) group is composed of three united, very hard working women living in the city of Danli’s Abajo neighborhood.  Following are details of each of their activities:

Mrs. Karla Judith A. is a merchant selling silver Jewelry, an activity she’s been in for three years.  She sells her items door to door in various firms like cigar factories and some private and public offices.  Most of the sales are on credit so she dedicates one day a week to collection of payments. Karla has a large customer base because her jewels are of very good quality, she has a wide selection and payment plans for her customers.  Karla is a single mother of a beautiful girl who is currently a student teacher at a local elementary school; all this thanks to Karla’s efforts to get ahead with her daughter.

Mrs. Dominga C. P. is a merchant selling primarily groceries in a grocery store she operates called “La Bendición.”  She’s been in business for over a year and it’s noteworthy that during this time she’s known how to run it well; her store is well stocked and her living conditions look promising.  Mrs. Minga, as she’s better known in the neighborhood, has a large customer base because her business is located in an area with workshops and other businesses so there is a lot of foot traffic.   She is in a common law relationship and has two children the oldest of whom is totally independent and the younger is in a local elementary school.

Mrs. Delfina Antonia C. is a merchant selling groceries in a store she runs called “Rocío.”  She has five years experience running it.  Delfina has a large customer base because of the strategic location of her store. Delfina is a widow and mother of three children who are adults and completely independent.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.use: To buy silver jewelry, rice, beans, sugar, lard, oil, coffee, bread, cookies, snacks, soft drinks, pasta, soup, spaghetti, cereal, oatmeal, soap, sweets, candles, batteries, matches.

loans.name: Zenaida Ciria

texts.es: La Sra. Zenaida Ciria M. D. P. vive junto a su esposo. Tiene casa propia la cual se encuentra ubicada en el distrito D. Santiago. La Sra. Zenaida se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes desD. hace varios años. Gracias a su empeño a logrado tener este negocio. Su esposo tambien se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes. La Sra. Zenaida a logrado tener este negocio gracias a su empeño y dedicación. Ella requiere el crédito para comprar un nuevo local en el centro D. la zona. La Sra. Zenaida está muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zenaida Ciria M. D. P. lives with her husband.  She has a house of her own in Santiago district.  Zenaida has been selling groceries for several years.  Thanks to her effort she has managed to have this business.  Her husband is also a grocer.  Zenaida has managed to have the business thanks to her effort and dedication.

She needs a loan to buy a new locale in the center of the zone.  Zenaida is very grateful for whatever support we may be able to proviD..

loans.use: To buy a new sales stall.

loans.name: Las Golondrinas De Paxboch Group

texts.es: Doña Marta Lidia I. D. L. D. P., casada D. 50 años D. edad, cursos en 5to primaria en la escuela, tiene 8 hijos, 2 D. la cuales estudian, se dedica a oficios domesticos, su esposo se dedica a las maquilas, el prestamo lo invertira para el cultivo D. hortalizas, ya que tiene 10 años ya D. experiencia con este trabajo, ella empezo a sembrar verduras(repollo) cuando tenia 20 años D. edad, quiere ver su negocio con un  buen capital y buenas ganancias, por lo que reune a 2 compañeras y 1 compañero para organizar un grupo y poder capitalizar el trabajo que realiza cada uno D. ellos, los integrantes D. este grupo se decican a diversas actividades productivas que son: amarre D. hilo y construccion D. vivienda, esperan mejorar sus condiciones D. vida y la D. su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. Marta Lidia I. D. León D. Pérez, 50, is married and finished fifth graD. in school.  She has 8 children two of whom are studying.  She is a housewife.  Her husband works in an assembly plant.  She will use the loan for her vegetable farming.  She has ten years experience in this line of work.  She started planting vegetables (cabbage) when she was 20 years old.  She wants to see her business with good capital and good profits so she got two girlfriends and a male friend together to form a group to capitalize each of their enterprises.  The members of the group are in various occupations like: weaving and house construction.  They hope to improve their and their families’ living conditions.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther, de 50 años de edad, natural del distrito de Anco, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora; esta casada con Alejandro de 45 años y tienen 06 hijos; juntos viven en su propia casa en la comunidad de Cuculipampa caserío del distrito de Samugari. Esther y su esposo Alejandro, son el sostén de sus hijos; ambos son campesinos y se apoyan mutuamente en las labores del campo. Labra la tierra durante 27 años, tiene una parcela, espacio que ha cultivado árboles maderables, cacao y café; productos oriundos de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. En tiempos de cosecha necesitan el apoyo de la mano ajena, por ello tiene que contratar jornaleros para avanzar con las extracciones de los frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus granos de cacao, café y por cada pie de madera.  En adelante desea comprar nuevas tierras y sembrar árboles maderables como: tornillo, caoba y cedro; pues tiene el objetivo de algún día heredarlos a sus hijos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo y esta dispuesta a cumplir puntualmente con sus cronogramas de pagos. Agradece a la institución Prisma por concederle el préstamo. Con los  2,500 nuevos soles solicitados,  contratará peones para aserrar madera.
texts.en:
Esther, 50, is from Anco district originally.  She is a very cheerful, hard working woman.  She’s married to Alejandro, 45, and they have six children.  They live together in their own house in the community of Cuculipampa in Samugari district.  Esther and her husband, Alejandro, are the source of support for their children.  They are both farmers who support each other in the field chores.

She has tilled the soil for 27 years.  She has a parcel of land where she has grown hardwood trees, cocoa beans and coffee, products that are typical of the Apurimac River Valley.  During harvest time she needs extra hands to help so she must hire day laborers to get ahead with the harvesting.

What she enjoys the most about her work is harvesting because that’s when she sees the long months of hard work rewarded in the quality of her fruits.  She considers transporting her crops from her field to the city of San Francisco, where the best prices are available for her cocoa beans, coffee and for each foot of lumber, to be the most difficult part.

Later on she’d like to buy more land and plant other hardwood trees like: mahogany, cedar and tornillo (tropical wood similar to elm) because her objective is to leave it to her children some day.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She feels this contribution will help her work’s progress very much and she is prepared to repay on time.  She is grateful to Prisma for granting the loan.  She will use the requested 2500 new soles to hire laborers to saw wood.

loans.use: To hire laborers to saw wood.

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es: Ysabel, de 60 años de edad, natural del distrito de San Miguel, esta casada con Teofilo de 58 años y tienen 04 hijos; juntos viven en su casa propia en la comunidad de Pampahuasi perteneciente al anexo del distrito de Samugari. Con mucho esfuerzo Ysabel y su esposo, han logrado remover sus tierras para volverlas muy productivas; Ysabel es agricultora se dedica a cultivar cacao, café y hojas de coca; que son productos sostenibles para su economía. En tiempos de cosecha Ysabel tiene que contratar jornaleros para extraer con rapidez los frutos de las plantas y para pode transportar los pesados sacos de cada producto desde la chacra hasta la comunidad de Pampahuasi. Viene trabajando 35 años en la agricultura y es conocedora de sus responsabilidades. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos ya que depende de eso el ingreso de su economía. Sus planes a futuro es remover sus tierras con abundante estiércol para volverlas muy productivas a sus sembrios. Este es su segundo crédito de manera individual  y a la vez  es socia en su banco comunal y es muy  responsable en cuanto a sus cronogramas de pagos con MFP, siente que el crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados,  contratará peones para realizar el desmonte de malezas y comprar una maquina despulpadora para extraer los granos de café.
texts.en:
Ysabel, 60, is from San Miguel district.  She’s married to Teofilo, 58, and they have four children.  They live together in their own house in the community of Pampahuasi in Samugari.  With great effort Ysabel and her husband have managed to till their lands making them very productive. Ysabel grows cocoa beans, coffee and coca leaf which are economically sustainable products.  During harvest time Ysabel has to hire helpers in order to quickly harvest the fruits and transport the heavy sacks from her fields to the community of Pampahuasi.

She has been working in agriculture for 35 years and she knows its requirements.  What she enjoys most about the work is caring for her crops since her income depends on them.  Her future plans are to mix in enough manure into the soil to make them very productive for her crops.

This is her second individual loan and she’s also a member of her communal bank; she is very responsible with respect to payment schedules to MFP.  She feels the loan will help her very much in her work’s progress.

She will use the requested 3000 new soles to hire laborers to clear weeds and will buy a hulling machine to extract the coffee beans.

loans.use: To hire laborers to clear weeds from her fields and also to buy a hulling machine.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Maria Magdalena tiene 42 años. Ella se dedica a una pulpería, hace más de 5 años que se dedica a esta humilde actividad. Ella tenía muchas dificultades y decido sacar a su familia adelante, y decide realizar la compra de ciertos productos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar y así iniciar este medio de vida. Debido a que sus ingresos no eran suficientes para sustentar a su hogar. Y es por este motivo que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de arroz, maíz, frijoles, azúcar entre otros productos. Ella tiene le deseo de establecer una tienda de ropa en su vivienda.
texts.en:
María Magdalena, 42, has had a grocery store; she’s been in this humble activity for over five years.  She used to have a lot of difficulties so she decided to move her family forward and bought certain products like rice, beans and sugar to start this way of life because her income was insufficient to support her household.

This is why she’s asking for this loan for working capital to buy rice, corn, beans and sugar, among other products.  She wants to set up a clothing store at home.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Comango Group

texts.es: Doña Catarina P. M., es casada, tiene 33 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela, tiene 6 hijos 2 de los cuales estudian, se dedica a la agropecuaria, crianza de animales, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es comerciante, ella decidio reunir a otra tres compañeros para formar un grupo, con el fin de solicitar un prestamo, el prestamos lo utilizaran para compra de ganado para posteriormente venderlos y devengar su ganacia de la inversion, tiene ya 10 años de experiencia de trabajar en la crianza de animales. Espera mejorar sus ingresos de ganancias y las los miembros de este grupo, ya que esto les traera mejores condicones de vida.
texts.en: Catarina is married, 33 years old and didn't have the opportunity to go to school. She has six children, two who are in school. She makes a living in agriculture, raising livestock with the help of her husband, who is a merchant. She decided to unite with three fellow livestock raisers to form a group to request a loan, which they plan to use to purchase cattle to later sell for a gain on their investment. Catarina has 10 years' experience raising livestock. She hopes to increase the profits for herself and her fellow group members so they can improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anyela Del Carmen

texts.es: Anyela Del Carmen tiene 34 años, por lo que su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella ofrece una variedad de productos, como la venta de granos básicos que es muy solicitada, golosinas, refrescos naturales, granos básicos, verduras, medicinas y detergentes. Es una persona muy alegre y trabajadora por lo que vive muy feliz con su negocio a pesar de ganar mucho con este negocio le proporciona lo necesario para mantenerse a ella y la familia. Ella solicita urgentemente para comprar la materia prima necesaria para mantener a sus clientes. Su deseo es mantener siempre su record crediticio porque sin él no podría avanzar con su negocio.
texts.en: Anyela is 34 years old and has made a living running a convenience store for the past 16 years. She offers a variety of products such as basic grains, which are in high demand, snacks, natural refreshments, vegetables, medicines and detergents. She is a very happy and hard-working person and is very satisfied with her business since she makes a lot and can provide what's necessary to support herself and her family. She is urgently requesting a loan to purchase merchandise so she can keep her customers. Her desire is to always have a good credit record because without it she would not be able to move forward her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a pickup truck for lawn-service business

loans.name: Bethy

texts.es: Bethy tiene 25 años de edad, natural del distrito de San Francisco, esta casada con Cipriano de 27 años y tienen 01 hijo llamado Hedrick de 04 años de edad;  juntos viven en su  propia casa  en la comunidad de Palmapampa anexo del distrito de Samugari. Con mucho esfuerzo Bethy y su esposo Cipriano, han logrado remover sus tierras para volverlas muy productivas; Bethy es agricultora y tiene una extensión de 06 hectáreas de terreno donde tiene plantaciones de cacao y café, que son productos sostenibles para su economía. En tiempos de cosecha Bethy tiene que contratar jornaleros para extraer con rapidez los frutos de las plantas. Viene trabajando 08 años y es conocedora de sus responsabilidades. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, ya que se siente muy feliz haciéndolo y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta la ciudad de san francisco lugar donde le  ofrecen mejores precios por sus granos de cacao y café. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras e incrementar más plantaciones de cacao. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. Agradece a la institución Prisma por concederle el crédito. Con los  2,000 nuevos soles solicitados, contratará jornaleros para realizar las cosechas de sus plantas.
texts.en:
Bethy is 25 years old and a native of the District of San Francisco. She is married to Cipriano, age 27, and they have a four year old son named Hedrick. They live in their own home in the community of Palmapampa Annex in the District of Samugari. Bethy and Cipriano have been able manage the crop rotation on their land to achieve very productive returns. She is a farmer and has a tract of land that contains six hectares where she plants cacao and coffee, products that provide sustainable income. At harvest time, Bethy must hire workers to quickly pick the fruit off the plants. Bethy has been working for eight years and knows her responsibilities. What she enjoys most about her job is caring for her crops since it makes her happy. She considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products from the field to the city of San Francisco, the place where she is offered the best prices for cacao and coffee beans. Going forward, she wants to buy more land so that she can plant more cacao.

This is her first loan with MFP. Bethy believes this support will greatly help her make progress in her work. She is grateful to Microfinanzas Prisma for granting her this loan. The disbursement of 2000 PEN that she requested will be used to pay workers for harvesting her crops.

loans.use: Pay workers to help with her harvest

loans.name: Clementina Bellanira

texts.es: Clementina tiene 46 años, su actividad económica es la vetan de ropa, hace mas de 20 años que se dedica a este humilde negocio. Ella es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y siempre le ha gustado sacar adelante a su familia son la parte más importantes en su vida. Inicio cuando decidió viajar a Managua a comprar mercadería y le dio muy buenos resultados pues le proporciono el alimento diario, es por eso que se ha interesado a mejorar sus ingresos con este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos y cosméticos. Su deseo es incrementar su negocio para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Clementina is 46 years old and sells clothes for a living. She has managed her modest business for more than twenty years. Clementina is a woman who enjoys working and has always liked helping her family succeed since they are a very important part of her life. When she started her business, Clementina decided to travel to Managua in order to buy merchandise. She achieved good results which allowed her to provide for her daily needs. Since then she has been interested in improving her business income.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses, and cosmetics. Her wish is to increase her business so that she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses, and cosmetics

loans.name: Carla Vanesa

texts.es: Carla Vanesa tiene 33 años. La actividad económica de ella es ofrecer el servicio de moto taxi. Hace 20 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues le resulta mucho mas favorable rentar la moto y establecer un precio determinado que obtiene, ya que ella sabe muy bien el negocio de costura pues también realiza este medio de vida. Sus compras las realizan de contado y fue por cuenta propia que inicio el servicio de moto taxi y al ver que este le generaba ganancias le fue de ayuda para los ingresos de su hogar. Ella solicita este financiamiento para proporcionarle mantenimiento.
texts.en:
Carla Vanesa is 33 years old and has a business offering motorcycle taxi services. She has been in this business for twenty years since it is much more favorable than renting a vehicle. This enables her to set a fixed price. Carla also knows how to sew and engages in this type of business. Her purchases are made on a cash basis.

By starting her own motorcycle taxi service, she is able to generate revenue to help with the household income. She is requesting this loan to pay for maintenance.

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 32 years old, married, and has two children, aged 15 and 9. She has a small grocery store in Ayacucho and will be using her loan of 2,100 nuevos soles to buy new products to stock the store. Judith was invited to FINCA Peru by a friend when she was 18 years old and has been a member for 14 years. She enjoys the regular meetings and training that FINCA provides, and would like to save enough money to buy land or a house in Ayacucho.

loans.use: Purchase of goods to sell in grocery store

loans.name: Elsa Raquel

texts.es:
Elsa, de 25 años de edad, nacida en el departamento de Estelí, soltera, de oficio sastre, tiene alrededor de 10 años de dedicarse a  esta actividad. Empezó a la edad de 15 años con la ayuda de su madre, con capital propio, ultimadamente ha tenido mucha demanda por parte de su clientela, ya que ella diseña uniformes para equipo locales de beisbol, su mama le enseño hacer muñecas de tela, elabora uniformes para fabricas, vestuarios para cantantes de mariachi, también hace bolsos y carteras con material reciclable como sobrantes de  jeans e incluso se diseña su propia ropa.
Solicita EL préstamo para compra de materia prima como telas de mejor calidad, ya que así  podrá promocionar mejor  su diseños, hacer más clientelas y dar una mejor calidad de sus productos. 
Sus planes futuros son tener  una  buena sastrería donde pueda dar empleo  a otras personas para poder suplir la creciente demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elsa is 25 years old and was born in the Department of Estelí. She is single and works as a seamstress. Elsa has been in this business for approximately ten years. She started out at the age of 15 by helping her mother. With her own capital, she ultimately generated great demand from her customers. Elsa has designed uniforms for local baseball teams. Her mother taught her how to produce cloth dolls, factory uniforms, costumes for mariachi singers, as well as purses and handbags made of recyclable materials such as leftover jeans. She even designs her own clothing.

Elsa is requesting a loan to buy materials such as high quality fabrics. This will help improve her designs, attract more customers, and result in better quality products. Her future plans include having a successful tailoring shop where she can provide employment to other people. This will allow her to keep up with the increasing demand from her customers.

loans.use: Purchase materials for making uniforms & business suits

loans.name: Yungüeñitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “YUNGÜEÑITAS” se encuentra en el ciclo número  diez y ocho en Pro Mujer, es parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana.  Está compuesta por diez integrantes.  
La asociación comunal “Yungüeñitas”, está dirigida por una mesa directiva, la presidenta, la señora Verónica, como tesorera la señora Juana y como secretaria de actas la señora Valentina.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados, entre ellos están: venta de tucumanas (empanadas fritas rellenas de gigote), venta de CD´s, negocio de INTERNET, venta de chicharrón, venta de mantas, confección de prendas, venta de chicharrón de pollo, elaboración de artesanías, venta de ropa.

La señora Verónica, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que forma parte de la 
A.C.  “Yungüeñitas” desde hace 9 años.  La señora Verónica tiene 38 años edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos,  el negocio  que tiene actualmente es la venta de comida, actividad que desempeña en la Ex tranca de la zona de Río Seco, recibe la ayuda de sus hijos.  La señora Verónica recuerda que su primer crédito fue $us100.-, y con este dinero comenzó el negocio, compro una cocina, platos, cubiertos, ollas y un sartén, un menaje de cocina básico, pero que le sirvió para emprender el negocio, años antes había aprendido a cocinar con su tía.
El crédito de este ciclo será destinado a comprar víveres por mayor.  La señora comenta que comprará los víveres de La Ceja de la Ciudad de El Alto.   En la foto se encuentra la asociación completa y una señora, que estaba compartiendo con el grupo.
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan  las capacitaciones, la atención del personal de Pro Mujer y compartir con el grupo.  En este tiempo ha asistido al consultorio y considera que  la atención es buena.
texts.en:
The “Yungüeñitas” Communal Association is in its eighteenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Community Center. There are ten members in this group. The “Yungüeñitas” Communal Association is led by its Board of Directors: Sra. Verónica (President), Sra. Juana (Treasurer), and Sra. Valentina (Secretary of Records). The members of the Communal Association engage in various businesses in order to get ahead. These include selling “tucumanas” (fried turnovers with a beef stew filling), selling CDs, managing an Internet café, selling pork rinds, selling blankets, tailoring, selling chicken dishes, making crafts, and selling clothes.

Sra. Verónica, the President of the Communal Association, says that she has been a member of “Yungüeñitas” for nine years. She is 38 years old, married, and has five children. Verónica currently manages a business selling food from an old tavern in the District of Río Seco. She receives assistance from her children. Sra. Verónica recalls that her first loan was in the amount of $100 USD, which she used to start her business. She bought a stove, dishes, cutlery, pots, a frying pan, and basic kitchen equipment to establish her business. Several years earlier, she learned to cook from her aunt.

Her loan for this cycle will be used to buy food in bulk. Sra. Verónica says that she buys her food in La Ceja in the city of El Alto. The entire Communal Bank is shown in the photo along with another woman who is sharing with the group. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Verónica says she enjoys the training classes, the personal attention Pro Mujer provides, and being able to share with the group. She has also visited the health clinic and says that she received good service.

loans.use: Purchase foods supplies in bulk

loans.name: Hilda Yovana

texts.es: La señora Hilda Yovana se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace un año , su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el Mercado de San Joaquín . La solicitante es soltera no tiene carga familiar por lo tanto ayuda a sus padres con los gastos familiares además tiene otro ingreso económico por que trabaja en un centro Comercial de Ica . Está solicitando el crédito para invertir en su negocio de ropa ya que comienza la campaña escolar, se propone otorgarle el préstamo ya que presenta experiencia crediticia con el BCP  y está pagando puntualmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Hilda Yovana has been selling clothes for one year. Her business is located at the San Joaquín Market. Hilda is single and has no family dependents, yet she helps her parents with their household expenses. She also earns extra income working at a shopping center in Ica.

Hilda is requesting a loan to invest in her clothing business since the beginning of the school year has started. She is being recommended for this loan because she has current credit experience with BCP and is submitting her payments on time.

loans.use: Operating capital for her clothing business

loans.name: Magaly  Yanet

texts.es:
Magali es una madre de familia de 29 años de edad. Vive con su esposo e hijo de 3 años de edad en el caserío El Verde en el distrito de Pítipo, una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la Región Lambayeque.

Cuenta con su terreno propio a pocos metros de su casa donde se dedica a la producción agrícola de cereales y maíz amarillo. Tiene más de 10 años de experiencia en esta actividad. Después de cosechar sus productos, vende su cosecha a algunos negociantes de la zona. Con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades se encarga del sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Desea invertir su préstamo en la siembra, el manejo y la cosecha de su terreno para ampliar la producción de su maíz amarillo. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles.

Magali es muy trabajadora y encargada a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima.
texts.en:
Magali is a 29 year old mother who lives with her husband and three year old son in the village of El Verde in the District of Pítipo. This farming district is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Magali has her own land a few meters from her house where she grows grain and yellow corn. She has more than ten years of experience in this business. After harvesting her products, she sells some of them to local traders. The earnings she generates from her business activities are used to sustain the family finances.

Magali wants to invest her loan in the planting, management, and harvesting on her land so that she can expand her production of yellow corn. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN.

Magali is a hard worker who manages her family well. The people she knows have great respect for her.

loans.use: Purchase seeds for planting yellow corn

loans.name: Gabi Mariela

texts.es:
Gabi es soltera tiene 35 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el sector Cerro La Falla, ubicado en el distrito de Olmos, una ciudad conocida como la capital del limón, situada a más de de hora y media de la cuidad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con un puesto de venta de ropa en uno de los mercados de la ciudad. Ella adquiere sus productos en la ciudad de Lima y los comercializa entre el público que diariamente acude a este mercado de abastos. Las prendas que vende son para todo público y actualmente cuenta con una clientela fidelizada. Los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad le sirven para ayudar a solventar su economía.

Gabi desea surtir en inventario de su negocio debido al cambio de temporada. Por ese motivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de  1500 nuevos soles con los cuales comprará diversas prendas como jeans, blusas, conjuntos para niños, entre otros, atendiendo a las solicitudes de sus clientes ya que existe una alta demanda por productos debido a que es conocida por dicha actividad en la zona.

Gabi se ha propuesto invertir en mostrar una mayor calidad de prendas puesto que es la única que vende prendas novedosas y de calidad  en el mercado.
texts.en:
Gabi is 35 years old, single, and lives with her family in the Cerro La Falla sector in the District of Olmos. This city is known as “the lemon capital” and located more than an hour and a half away from the city of Chiclayo.

Gabi has a clothing stand at one of the markets in the city. She acquires her products in the city of Lima and sells them to the public who come to the market every day. Gabi sells clothes for all ages and currently has a loyal customer base. The earnings from her business help to cover her finances.

Gabi wants to restock the inventory of her business according to the change in season. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN. The money will be used to buy different garments such as jeans, blouses, children’s outfits, and other items so that she can fulfill the existing orders from her customers since these products are in high demand. Gabi is known in the area for her business.

She plans to invest in high quality clothes since she is the only vendor at the market who sells new garments that are well-tailored.

loans.use: Purchase  jeans, blouses, children’s outfits, and other items

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn M., 44, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Charlie M., and they have one college-aged child. With her family, she manages their household and operates their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marilyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to local neighbors. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. Marilyn earns money by purchasing inventory at wholesale prices and then selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors from the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 8,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages in order to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marilyn hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To expand product inventory

loans.name: Thoeurn's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group has thirteen members, all of whom live in Akreiy Ksatr village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Thoeurn N. married woman was born in 1979, and she is a village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. She earns her living by being a wedding beautician. With her current business, she would like to ask for a loan to purchase more wedding beautician supplies and beauty salon for selling and using.  

Mrs. Thoeurn N.’s husband, Sok Bros sells coal. With their carriers, they are able to earn a small income to help support the family. 

This couple has a child who is just 3 years old.

loans.use: To purchase more wedding beautician supplies and beauty salon for selling and using.

loans.name: Pea's Group

texts.en:
The 14 people who make up this village bank loan live in Akreiy Ksatr village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Pea M., born in 1969, is the village bank president, and was selected for this position by the other members. Her husband, Mr. Meas Rotha, born in 1968, works as a motorcycle taxi driver who is able to earn a small income to help support his family. The couple has six children: two are waitresses in a restaurant, and the others are students. They all try to help support their parents' businesses. 

Mrs. Meas Rotha earns her living by selling groceries in the local village. In order to support and enlarge this business, she is asking for a loan in order to purchase more groceries to offer for sale.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to offer for sale

loans.name: Horl's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 12 members, all of whom live in Tep Archun village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Horl S., born in 1962, is the village bank president, and was selected for this position by the other members. Her husband, Mr. Soa Sophal, also born in 1962, earns a small income as a police officer, and he also helps his wife in her farming business. The couple has four children: one is a truck driver, one is a farmer, and the other two are students. 

Mrs. Horl S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land which she uses to grow peanuts and corn for a living. Aside from being a farmer, she also sells fish at the local market.

In order to support her farming business, she is requesting a loan in order to buy peanut seeds and corn seeds, as well as to pay for hired laborers to plow her farm in preparation for growing her crops.

loans.use: To buy peanut seeds and corn seeds to plant, as well as to pay for hired laborers to plow her farmin preparation for growing her crops.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 54 years old, married and supports her family by operating a general store, selling rice and selling BBQ. She lives in Victorias City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1988 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her General Store, Rice Retailing and BBQ Vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 30,000. Betty is borrowing PHP 22,000 to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 20th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Betty aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en: Carol is a 27-year-old single woman who supports her family by operating two businesses: Barbecue/Food vending and "Balot" (fertilized duck eggs) vending. Carol joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Carol has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000 which she added to her own capital helped her earn a monthly income of PHP 8000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital to save up for the future security of her family and to continue growing her business. She plans to improve her food vending business and engage in personal products direct selling business. Carol is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of six people who live in Tep Archun village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Srey P.  was selected to be the group leader by the other members. She was born in 1967, and she is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice for a living.  To support this farming, she would like a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticide.   Her husband, Mr. Sán An, is a homebuilder who earns a small income to support his family.  He also helps in his wife’s farming. This couple has three children: One is a car mechanic, one earns a salary in a supermarket, and the last one is a student.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticide

loans.name: Soeun's Group

texts.en:
In Tep Archun village in Kandal province, there are 11 people making up a village bank loan. Mrs. Soeun C., born in 1965, is the village bank president and was selected to this position by the other members. 

She and her husband, Mr. Chheoun Sovann, are farmers who own a plot of land where they grow corn, rice, and various vegetables. They grow and sell these crops to support their family. At present, they do not have sufficient funds to prepare the farm to grow their crops. This is why Mrs. Soeun C. is requesting a loan. With the loan, she will buy corn seeds and fertilizers and will be able to pay for hired laborers to plow her farm in preparation for growing rice.  

This couple has five children, four of whom are students who also help support their parents' farming business. The youngest is five years old and not yet in school.

loans.use: To buy corn seeds and fertilizers as well as to pay for hired laborers to plow the farmland in preparation for growing rice

loans.name: Dareen

texts.en:
Dareen is a married woman who lives in Victorias City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: selling salted peanuts and selling frozen foods. Her husband Wilmer, who is 38 years old, works as an administrator of a fishing boat to earn his living. They have four children who are between 2 and 12 years old. Dareen joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Dareen has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use as additional capital to save up for the future education of her children and to build their own house. Dareen is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline A. is from the village of Bugo, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 40 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of coconuts in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Evangeline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPF, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional coconuts to sell. This loan will be Evangeline's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,000. Shirley is borrowing PHP 15,000 to purchase raw materials. This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Shirley aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

Mrs. Koem N. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows rice. In order to support this farming, she would like a loan to buy fertilizers and gasoline to support her crop.

Milagros M. is from the village of Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 50 years old. Milagros is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Milagros owns & operates a general store.  She sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Milagros has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Milagros joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Milagros has successfully repaid a previous loan of 21,000 PHP from ASKI. That loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Milagros is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Milagros from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions for her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people have formed a village bank loan in Kbal Kaoh village in Kandal province.

Mrs. Sok K. was born in 1954 and is the village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows rice for a living.  Her husband, Mr. In Sorin, was born in 1950 and works as a teacher.   He is able to earn a small salary to help support his family. This couple has two children: One is a photo designer, and one is working in Acleda bank and also studying. 

With her child studying, she now faces a problem because she doesn’t have enough money to pay for school fees.   She asks for a loan to pay for her child's school fees.

loans.use: To pay for her child's school fee.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita ives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a dried fish vending business and a jewelry business.  Her common-law husband Pablito,  who is 60 years old, works as a dried dish vendor to earn his living.  Emelita has 10 children who are between 16 and 40 years old. Emelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Emelita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 18,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000, which she intends to use as funds for her business operations to continue to save up for future expansion of her business and for family needs. Emelita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

In 2010, Fatima joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fatima is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Fatima from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 47 years old, married and supports her family by operating a sari-sari (general) store and running an Avon business. She lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari store and Avon business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 14,000. Estrella is borrowing PHP 12,000 to purchase more stocks to sell.  This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Estrella aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows rice for a living. In order to support this farming, she would like a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline for growing rice. Aside from farming, she is also has a job where she is able to earn a small salary to help support her famiL..

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a married woman who lives in Brooke's Point, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a fish vending business and a fishing business. Her husband Julio, who is 29 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are between 5 and 11 years old. Julia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Julia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000, which she intends to use to buy plywood & fish net for fishing so that she can save up for the future education of her children. Julia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). loans.name: Chorn's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five members who are located in Tep Archun village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Chorn P. was born in 1943 and is the group leader.  She was selected to be the group leader by the other members. She and her husband, Mr. Preap Kit, are farmers who own a 1.20-hectare plot of land on which they grow corn and rice. With this farming, they have not had enough money to increase the yield.  So Mrs. Chorn P. would like a loan to buy fertilizers, gasoline, and to pay for hired farming laborers to grow rice and corn. 

This couple has a child who is a wedding chef.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, gasoline, and to pay hired laborers for growing rice and corn.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
This is Rosalina T., 43, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Jaime T., an entrepreneur. Together they have two children, one who is in college and one who is working and helping out with the family expenses. Rosalina, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosalina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Rosalina earns her income by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and selling the items separately. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rosalina hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: Buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

Mrs. Kol N. is a farmer who owns a 2.30-hectare plot of land,  which she uses to cultivate rice to sell for her family's daily needs. In order to support this farming, she would like a loan to pay for hired farm laborers to cultivate rice. With the rest of the loan, she will buy flour for her Khmer cake-making business.  She earns other income by making Khmer cakes to sell in the local village.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is a married woman who lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: Pig Fattening, Videoke and selling frozen foods. Her husband Rex, who is 50 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living. They have seven children who are between 15 and 28 years old. Genara joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Genara has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 30,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 4th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use as funds for her business operations so that she can continue to save up for future family needs. Genara is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. This group loan consists of five members, all of whom live in Kampong Samnanh village in Kandal province. Mrs. Choeun B., born in 1941, is the group leader. She was selected for this position by the other members. 

Mrs. Choeun B. earns a small income to support her family by offering rooms for rent. Though her tenants provide her with a small living, she does not earn enough money to support her family. For this reason, she has decided to ask for a loan in order to buy rice for her family's food intake. 

She is a widow with five children: one is a electrician, three are seamstresses in the garment factory, and the last is a student.

loans.use: To buy rice for her family's food intake

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
This is Geraldine Z., 31, a resident of Caloocan City City, Philippines. She is married to Demetrio Z., a security guard, and the mother of their three children. The entire family helps to manage the household while operating the business. At this time, Geraldine is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Geraldine operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, Php5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Arlene earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house, and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Geraldine is requesting a Php10,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her enterprise.

Geraldine hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Each comprised of 15 to 30 community partners, the fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory
