She is applying for this loan from MCDT SACCO, for 800,000 Ugandan Shillings, to buy more clothing to sell and also to begin selling beverages such as soda and piped water. She will use the additional income made possible by this loan to buy food, and pay school feels and the rent for her house, which has electricity and piped-in water. The main challenge she faces is the seasonality of her business. Her long-term goal is to build rental houses, because this is a far less seasonable business.

loans.use: To buy new items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Secundino

texts.en: For the last 20 years, Mr. Secundino R. has made a living selling clothes. His wife has been in the same line of work for the last decade and specializes in women's sportswear. Mr. R. is applying for a loan to buy more clothing to sell to his customers, and wishes to thank Fundación Paraguaya  and Kiva lenders for the good service and assistance they provide to small businesses such as his.

loans.use: To buy shirts, pants, t-shirts, jeans and women's sportswear to sell to his customers

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary K. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has five children, one of whom is completing university level studies. The other four have all finished school. Mary makes a living by running a retail shop where she sells food. She has been in this business for 20 years, and works seven days a week. She is applying for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more items to sell to her customers. Mary supplements the income she earns in her store by renting out houses. She owns the house she lives in, which has electricity and piped-in water, and her largest single monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 36 years old, married and blessed with three children. He makes a living by selling green maize in Gikomba's open-air market, and supplements the income he earns there by running a boutique.  He has benefited from his affiliation with Faulu Kenya, which has provided him with loans to expand his business. His goal is to become a major supplier of green maize in the next five years.  He will use this loan, for 60,000 Kes, to buy more green maize to sell to his customers,

loans.use: To buy more green maize to sell to his customers

loans.name: Mwanapili

texts.en:
Mwanapili is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbours. In addition she is also employed at the municipal council where she earns her other source of income. Mwanapili faces the challenge of competition from other retail shop operators. She hopes to expand her business and become more reliable in the future.

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase bags of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, sugar and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase bags of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline O. lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. Jackline has a business selling fish. She works 7 days a week. Jackline sells her products at the market.

Jackline has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO.

The main business challenge for Jackline is seasonality. Jackline lives in a home that she rents and has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses is food.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Mwamba Group

texts.fr: K. K. est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe d’affaire M., âgée de 37 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants qui étudient tous, sauf le cadet. Son mari est un chauffeur taximan. La cliente  K. K. est  vendeuse des bananes, huile de palme, etc. Elle s’installe à son domicile devant sa porte. Elle démarra son activité avec un fonds propre reçu de son mari. Il ya 4 ans qu’elle est en activité. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’acheter 2 sacs des charbons, 1 bidon d’huile de palme, 1 bidon d’huile Rina.  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, vêtir et scolariser ses enfants confortablement. La cliente K. K. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe M. est constitué de 35 membres.
texts.en:
K. K. is an entrepreneur, and president of the M. business group, which consists of 35 members. She is 37 years old, married, and the mother of six children who all attend school except for the youngest. Her husband is a taxi driver. 

K. K. sells bananas, palm oil, etc. in front of her home. She started her business four years ago with her own capital received from her husband. She will use her new loan to buy two bags of charcoal, one can of palm oil, and one can of Rina oil. She plans to expand her business, clothe her children, and provide them with an education. 

K. K. wishes to thank Hekima for their assistance to underprivileged women who cannot turn to traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy 2 bags of charcoal, a can of palm oil, and a can of Rina oil

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a widowed woman with seven children, two of whom still attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a paraffin-selling business for over ten years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Christine faces a major challenge of competition from other paraffin sellers in the area. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the 10,000 KES, she wants to purchase paraffin for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase paraffin for sale.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua M. is a 60-year-old banana sales businessman who plys his trade in Nyabitete food market in the Rukungiri district of Western Uganda. It is now over 6 years since he began his business. What plays into his favour is the fact that he has a banana plantation where he is able to readily get bananas on a regular basis.

Joshua is, on the face of things, a dedicated and determined man who wants the best for the welfare of his family of 5 kids and wife. He says this business generates him 160,000 shillings a week.

With this loan, Joshua says he is going to upgrade and buy more manure for his banana plantation.

loans.use: The purchase of manure for his banana plantation

loans.name: Vicente Rubén

texts.en:
Mr. Vicente M., 52 years old, is married to Mrs. Mary Viveros.  They have 2 adult children.

Before beginning his current activity, Mr. Vincent worked as a truck driver for someone else, but then gave up that work.  With a settlement payment, he was able to obtain the capital necessary to undertake his current activity of producing bricks.

This activity was started about 15 years ago, so he already has experience and a clientele for his good quality products.  The requested loan is for expanding the furnace where he fires the bricks.

Mr. Vincent thanks the foundation for the loan obtained and hopes to offer his customers more of the same quality of his products.

loans.use: Expanding of furnace

loans.name: Cate

texts.en:
Cate N. lives in the Kikuubo neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has  three children, all of whom are in school. Cate has a business selling snacks and drinks.  She has been in this business for ten years, and she works seven days out of every week. Cate sells her products  in a shop. She has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more snacks and drinks to sell.    

The main business challenge for Cate is transportation. Cate lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include electricity and food.

loans.use: to purchase eatables and drinks

loans.name: Sop Serigne Mansour Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP SERIGNE MANSOUR est créé le 30 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 24 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce et la transformation d'huile d'arachide. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KELLE N.

Madame BATOR D. debout à l'extrême droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 59 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle a ausii la charge d'un enfant qui lui est confié par un proche. 

Elle fait de la transformation et vente d'huile d'arachide. Elle vend également du mil, du mait et du sucre

Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille et de renforcer son niveau d'épargne au niveau du Banc Villageois.
texts.en:
The solidarity group SOP SERIGNE MANSOUR was created on December 30, 2009. The group is made up of 24 women who are all from the same village. Their main activity is small-scale retail, and making peanut oil. 

The group belongs to the Kelle N. Banc Villageois. Mrs. Bator D., standing at the far right of the photo, is the group's leader. She is 59 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She is also responsible for the child of a close relative. Mrs. D. makes and sells peanut oil. She also sells millet, milk and sugar. Her goal is to contribute to a higher standard of living for her family and to increase the level of her savings with the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: To buy peanuts, sugar, milk and millet

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has  five children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

Harriet has a business sewing and selling clothes. She has been in this business for 15 years, and she works six days out of every week. Harriet has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of material. Her goal is to eventually build a house. Harriet lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water.

loans.use: more rolls of material

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy B. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has  no children. Teddy has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for two years, and she works seven days out of every week. Teddy has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more charcoal. 

The main business challenge for Teddy is seasonality.  Her goal is for her business to expand.    Teddy has access to electricity and to piped water.

loans.use: more charcoal

loans.name: Japheth

texts.en:
Japheth is 44 years old, married and blessed with six daughters.  He runs Jose Designers where he does tailoring.  He has been running the business for the past eight years.  He mainly makes ladies’ clothes.  

He joined Faulu Kenya in the Maridadi group which is known for its good reputation.  He is an active member of the group who pays his weekly dues faithfully.  For this reason, he has been guaranteed a loan of 70,000 Kes by the group members.  He will use the money to buy fabric.  He hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en: 44-year-old T. Leonard has been teaching for the past three years in Rwemiringa-Rukungiri. The happily married mother of nine is a grade three teacher and monthly she earns shillings 270,000 shillings. She also has a banana plantation where she harvests and sells bananas albeit on a small scale. Leonard says she is going to use the proceeds from this loan to pay the school fees of her nine kids.

loans.use: paying the school fees of her kids

loans.name: Mwanahuru

texts.en:
Mwanahuru is a divorced woman with eight children, three of whom still attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She operates a doughnut-selling business, selling at the market and from home to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanahuru hopes to expand her business and open a retail shop business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to pay school fees for her son who is in secondary school. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to educate her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her son who is in secondary school.

loans.name: Marysol

texts.es:
La señora Marysol trabaja realizando tramites en derechos reales y su esposo trabaja con movilidad en el Sindicato de transportes Simón Bolívar; el crédito requiere para la reparación y mantenimiento de la movilidad de su esposo, para continuar trabajando en el transporte de pasajeros.
Marysol vive en alquiler en la zona de Villa Nueva Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz, está casada pero no tiene hijos.
texts.en:
Ms. Marysol works completing property law paperwork and her husband works in transportation, as part of the Simón Bolívar Transportation Union. She needs this loan for the repair and maintenance of her husband's vehicle, so he can continue his work transporting passengers.

Marysol lives in a rented home in the Villa Nueva Potosí zone in the city of La Paz. She is married but does not have any children.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of her husband's passenger vehicle

loans.name: Fatima Maria

texts.es: La señora Fátima tiene 34 años, es casada con dos hijos menores de edad a su cargo, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa. Se siente muy satisfecha con este negocio, pues todos los días sale a ofrecer los diferentes productos que ofrece la mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan variedad de productos. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, pantalones y camisas. Su meta es llegar a mejorar sus ingresos y brindar mejoras económicas a ella y a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatima is 34 years old, married and has two young children who are her dependants. This is not the first time she has requested a loan. She sells clothing and is very satisfied with her business. She goes out every day to offer her products and her costumers request a wide variety of them. 

The loan will be utilized to purchase pants, shirts, skirts, and suits. Her goal is to improve her income to better provide for her children and herself.

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a married woman who lives in Silay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  perfumes/cosmetics sales and fish vending.  Her husband Roland, who is 46 years old, works as a government employee to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are 12 to 24 years old. Elisa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 20 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Elisa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 21st loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use to buy perfumes/cosmetics to sell to continue to save up for future house renovations.  Elisa is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more perfumes/cosmetics

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: 42-year-old T. Lilian sells bananas in Kanyanka Food market-Rukungiri. Weekly this business generates shillings 120,000 as sales profits. Before she embarked on this business, Lilian, who is a happily married mother of four, says she was selling used clothing. She still sells old clothes though it is now more of a secondary business. She says with this loan she is going to buy manure for her banana gardens.

loans.use: The purchase of manure for her banana gardens

loans.name: Takku Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité TAKKU LIGGEY est créé depuis moins d'une année. Il est composé de 15 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Elles se regroupées par des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d'amité. Leurs praincipales activités sont l'embouche et le petit commerce. 

Madame YACINE G. debout à l'extrême droite de la photo emmitoufflée d'une écharpe orange est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. 

Elle fait du petit commerce de savons, d'encens, de parfums etc. Elle fait aussi de l'embouche ovine. Elle mène cette activité depuis plus de 5 ans.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'améliorer ses activités.

Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne tout en soutenant son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The Takku Liggey Solidarity Group was created less than a year ago.  It is made up of 15 women who are all from the same village.  They formed this group around kinship ties, as neighbors and in friendship.  Their main business is fattening livestock and petty sales.

Mrs. Yacine G., standing at the far right of the photo wrapped in the orange scarf, is the leader of the group.  She is 41 years old, married and the mother of four children.  She sells soap, incense, perfume, etc.  She also fattens sheep.  She has led this business for over five years.

Her new loan will allow her to improve her business.  Her goal is to strengthen her savings in order to support her husband in managing the household.

loans.use: Purchasing soap, incense, perfume and fattening livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tires, battery and radio for his radio taxi

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman who lives in Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a vegetable plantation/farming.  Her husband Ivan, who is 54 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living. They have no children. Helen joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past seven loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Helen has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her eighth loan, she is borrowing PHP 23,000, which she intends to use as additional capital for her business so that she can continue to save up for house improvements and prepare for her future.  L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: Additional capital for her farm

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 33 years old, married and has two children aged 3 and 6.  He uses his bicycle to transport sodas over short distances.  He has been earning a living from this business for nine years.  He also does poultry and livestock farming, thanks to Faulu Kenya's helping him to buy cows and chickens.  He has also managed to install water in his house.  

He was previously supplying fruit for a living.  He has requested 60,000 Kes to get capital to start a charcoal business.

loans.use: To start charcoal-selling business

loans.name: Guadalupe Ramona

texts.es: Guadalupe tiene 43 años, su actividad económica es la elaboración y venta de comida. Hace más de 5 años en  donde poco a poco fue ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad, y nos cuenta que le va muy bien en sus ventas, hoy ya es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes, por la rica sazón que le pone a sus comidas. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y a través de los tiempos ha mejorado cada día sus ingresos para mantener a sus 3 hijos que son muy importantes para ella. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será destinado en la compra de carnes, verduras, maduro, granos básicos, queso entre otros productos. Su deseo es mantener siempre su negocio activo.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 43 years old. Her source of income, for more than 5 years, has been the preparation of meals. She gradually gained experience and reports that her sales are doing well. She is appreciated by her costumers and her meals have a reputation for their excellence.

She is a hard worker and has been able to increase her income to support her children who are very important to her.

The loan will be used as working capital to buy meats, vegetables, plantain, grains, cheese and other ingredients. She hopes to maintain her business for a long time.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anna Mary

texts.en:
Anna Mary M. lives in the Kyebanda Central neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has  six children. She also takes care of her grandchildren. 

Anna Mary has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 15 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Anna Mary sells her product door-to-door, wholesale. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO. She also generates additional income through renting out houses. 

The main business challenges for Anna Mary include seasonality, thieves, and transportation.  Anna Mary lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and to piped water.

loans.use: more charcoal

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a 61-year-old single woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: selling Ready-to-Wear clothes and selling hardware merchandise. She lives in Valladolid, Negros Occidental. Luisa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Luisa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future needs of her family.  R. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Monthly payments for his daughter's education

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has  five children, all of whom are in school. Rose has a business selling locally made gin, called "walagi".  She has been in this business for five years, and she works seven days out of every week. 

Rose has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more "walagi". She also generates additional income through running a small restaurant.

The main business challenges for Rose include thieves and seasonality.  Her goal is to make enough money to have a good standard of living. Rose has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: buying locally made gin, "walagi"

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase of better manure

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 45-year-old widow who supports her family by operating three business ventures:  used clothing, Avon & Natasha dealer and a manicure/pedicure/weaving business.  She lives in Toledo City, Cebu. Lilian joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lilian has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,200, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use to buy items for her used clothing business so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and to have her own business area. Lilian is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund the operations of her business

loans.name: Jovans

texts.en:
Jovans K. lives in the Lubya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has  five children, all of whom are in school. Jovans has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works seven days out of every week. Jovans sells her product at the market. Jovans has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to increase her capital.     

The main business challenge for Jovans is seasonality.  Her goal is to earn a good living in the future.   Jovans lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.

loans.use: buying more charcoal

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: Paula  tiene 59 años. Por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para el buen funcionamiento de su negocio. Ella se dedica a una pulpería, inicio hace mas de 6 años con muy pocos productos, debido a que no poseía mucho capital de trabajo, por lo que poco a poco es que ha ido mejorando su actividad ya que siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar cada día más. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos naturales, juegos, pan y galletas. Por lo que sueña con incrementar su capital de trabajo pues le gustaría mantener siempre esta actividad económica.
texts.en:
Paula is 59 years old.  This is not the first time she has obtained financing so her business will do well.

She has a general store which she started more than six years ago with very few products because she did not have much capital.  Little by little she has been improving her business because she is always looking for ways to do better everyday.

This loan will be used to purchase basic grains, sweets, natural soft drinks, juices, bread and cookies.  Paula dreams of increasing her working capital because she would like to have this business always.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: 34-year-old K. Martin is a happily married mother of three beautiful kids who all enjoy school. The hard-working Martin has been running a beauty salon business for the past 5 years in Rukungiri Town. Monthly this business generates around 200,000 Ugandan shillings and with this loan, Martin says she is going to purchase more and better salon equipment for use at her salon.

loans.use: The purchase of more and better salon equipment

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 46 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 hijos, a quienes mantiene sola, ya que lleva bastante tiempo separada de su esposo. Con mucho esfuerzo, Carmen logró levantarse de la caída de su tienda de Maletas, la cual no pudo administrar por estar enferma. Ahora viendo el mercado de la ciudad de Tarma, decidió alquilar un local y instalar el servicio de locutorio, y en el que ahora son muchos los que concurren su negocio, resultándole muy rentable y beneficioso.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes y eso siempre les enseña a sus hijos, quienes cuando ella no esta atienden el locutorio. Lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y espera que su negocio crezca y le pueda brindar mejores ingresos económicos. Este es el onceavo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y esta dispuesta a hacerlo, ya que no quiere perjudicar a su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida, por la solidaridad que demuestra. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará una nueva cabina, para poder atender a más clientes a la vez.
texts.en:
Carmen, 46, is a very hardworking woman.  She lives in her own house with her three children, whom she supports on her own because she has been separated from her husband for a long time.

Carmen was able to come back from the failure of her suitcase store, which she could not run because she was ill.  Seeing the market in the city of Tarma, she decided to rent a store and install phone booth service there.  Many people now come to her business, which makes it very profitable and beneficial to her.  What she likes most about her work is helping her customers, and this is what she teaches her children, who run the phone booth service when she is not there.  She has been doing this for two years and hopes that her business will grow and give her a better income.

This is Carmen's eleventh loan with MFP.  She knows she must make her payments on time, and she is ready to do so because she does not want to hurt her communal bank, where she is well-loved for the comradeship she shows.  With the thousand new soles she asked for, she will buy a new booth so she can serve more customers at the same time.

loans.use: Purchase a new booth to offer phone service

loans.name: Jose Benito

texts.es: José Benito de 64 años, tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente. José se dedica a la elaboración y venta de bloques, la venta está ubicada en su casa de habitación, lugar el cual es muy bueno para la venta, ya que se encuentra en un lugar muy concurrido, ya que tiene muchos clientes que siempre apreciar los productos de él. El negocio es muy estable, por lo que solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder aumentar su inventario comprando hierro, arena y cemento. Todo esto con el deseo de mejorar sus ventas y así contar con una vida mejor para él y su familia.
texts.en: José Benito is 64 years old and has 3 children who all work independently.  José works making blocks and selling them from his home.  His home is in a very good location for making his sales since it is in a very busy area.  He has many customers who always like to buy from him.  José Benito's business is very stable and he is requesting a loan to increase his inventory by purchasing iron, sand and cement.  He does all this with a desire to improve his sales and thereby forge a better life for himself and his family.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor N. is a 60-year-old father of six who has for the last decade been running a banana sales business in Katokomailo food market-Rukungiri. He also sells crude alcohol and is also a teacher. Being a farmer has helped Victor a lot as he is able to get bananas from his gardens to sell at his convenience. Per month this business generates shillings 120,000 and he says with this loan he is going to buy manure for his banana gardens.

loans.use: The purchase of manure for his gardens

loans.name: Las Cruces Group

texts.es: Doña Nilda Marisel S. G., es casada, tiene 35 años D. edad, cursó el segundo grado D. educación primaria, tiene 5 hijos 3 D. los cuales estan estudiando, ella es ama D. casa, su esposo se dedica como jornalero, quiere ampliar su credito para criar y vender a pollos D. engorD.. Por esta razon decidio reunir a otra compañeras vecinas para formar un grupo y D. esa manera solicitar un prestamos para utilizarlo como capital D. trabajo,las integrantes D. este grupo se dedican a diversas actividades produtivas como son: venta D. pollos, crianza D. pollos y la crianza D. marranos. Esperan que con dicho prestamos mejoren su condicion D. vida y no ser ambulantes como hasta ahora.
texts.en:
Nilda Marisel S. G. is married, 35 years old, and studied up to the second year of elementary school.  She has 5 children, 3 of whom are studying.

Nilda is a housewife and her husband works as a laborer.  Nilda requires her loan to buy chickens that she can fatten and then sell.  With this in mind, she decided to get together some friends and neighbors to create a group so that they could request a loan to use as working capital.  The members of this group carry out a range of business activities such as selling chickens, raising chickens and raising pigs.  They hope that through their loans they will improve their living conditions and no longer remain itinerant as they have been up until now.

loans.use: Capital for raising chickens

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has five children; all her children go to school. Jalia has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for twenty years, and she works seven days out of every week. Jalia sells her product from home. Jalia has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO.

The main business challenge for Jalia is seasonality.  Her goal is to eventually buy more land.   Jalia lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity but doesn’t have access to piped water.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: Maria De La Concepción tiene 64 años, tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. Por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para el buen funcionamiento de su negocio. Ella se dedica a una pulpería, inicio hace mas de 11 años con muy pocos productos, debido a que no poseía mucho capital de trabajo, por lo que poco a poco es que ha ido mejorando su actividad ya que siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar cada día más. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos naturales, juegos, pan y galletas. Por lo que sueña con incrementar su capital de trabajo pues le gustaría mantener siempre esta actividad económica.
texts.en:
Maria De La Concepción is 64 years old and has one child in her care.  This is not the first time that she has taken loans to improve the running of her business.   

Maria's business is a small grocery store that she set up 11 years ago.  She started out with very few products as she didn't have much working capital.  She has gradually improved her business and is always looking for ways to improve it every day.  She is requesting this loan to buy basic grain, candy, natural soft drinks, juice, bread and cookies.  She dreams of increasing her working capital since she would like to always remain in her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children; all her children go to school. She also takes care of orphans. Jenifer has a business selling bananas.  She has been in this business for five years, and she works six days out of every week. Jenifer sells her products from door to door. Jenifer has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO.

The main business challenge for Jenifer is transportation.  Jenifer lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: to buy bananas

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es: Esmeralda, de 45 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en un cuarto alquilado junto a sus dos hijas Grisell de 26 y Linsey de 11 años, a quienes desea dar una buena calidad de vida. Recorriendo las calles de la ciudad de Tarma, Esmeralda lleva una variedad de cosméticos, pues es una vendedora muy convincente y siempre esta en constante actividad, visitando a sus amigas y clientes que ha logrado captar. Por tanto ella siempre procura renovar y abastecerse de productos novedosos. Siente que su trabajo es muy rentable, ya que gracias a él, puede brindarles a sus hijos los estudios que se merecen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre los productos que deben usar, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que debería instalar una tienda, donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad sus productos de belleza. Este es el décimo primer crédito con MFP y está muy feliz de poder obtenerlo, manifiesta que invertirá todo el crédito en su negocio, ya que quiere mejorar su vida. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre. Con los  setecientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos de belleza, para así poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de cosméticos.
texts.en:
45 year-old Esmeralda is a very hard-working and cheerful woman.  She lives in a rented room together with her two daughters, 26 year-old Grisell and 11 year-old Linsey, for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life.

Walking the streets of the city of Tarma, Esmeralda carries with her a range of cosmetics.  She is a very persuasive saleswoman who is constantly active, visiting her friends and the customers that she has managed to attract.  She is always trying to renew her stock and stock up with the latest products.  She feels that her work is very profitable since it has enabled her to provide her children with the education that they deserve.  What she most likes about her work is advising her customers on which products they should use.  She has been in this business for 7 years and she believes that she should set up a store where she could sell her beauty products more comfortably.

This is Esmeralda's tenth loan with MFP and she is very happy to be receiving it.  She tells us that she will invest all the loan money in her business since she wants to improve her life.  Esmeralda is a very cheerful member of her community bank.  She will use her 700 Peruvian soles to buy more beauty products so that she can offer her customers a larger variety of cosmetics.

loans.use: To stock up with cosmetics to fill her customers' orders

loans.name: Norman

texts.en: 31-year-old N. Norman is an agro sales businessman mostly dealing in bananas. He operates his business from Kanyambe food market-Rukungiri. He also sells coffee. These two businesses have over the course of time enabled him to give a better well-being to his family of three kids and one wife. Weekly the banana sales business generates shillings 150,000 and he says with this loan he is going to purchase better manure for his banana gardens.

loans.use: The purchase of better manure

loans.name: Sergio Antonio

texts.es: Sergio Augusto tiene 43 años, es un hombre muy responsable y disfruta de su trabajo. Su actividad es la venta de ropa usada, hace mas de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, Anteriormente el señor no tenía un trabajo, pero impulsado por la necesidad de todo padre responsable de 3 hijos a su cargo, tenía que buscar la manera de obtener un rubro que le generara ingresos, por lo que decide aprender este oficio y empezar a ganar lo necesario para solventar los gastos del hogar. Ahora solicita este financiamiento para la compra de faldas, pantalones, camisas, trajes entre otros. Sueña con agrandar su negocio y mejorar la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Sergio Augusto is 43 years old.  He is a very responsible man who enjoys his work.  His business is selling used clothing and he has been in this business for more than 10 years.

Sergio Augusto was previously out of work but he was motivated, as is any responsible father who has 3 children in his care, to find a line of work that would make income for his family.  For this reason, he decided to learn this trade and began to earn the money he needed to cover his household expenses.

Sergio Augusto is requesting this loan to buy skirts, pants, shirts, dresses, etc.  He dreams of expanding his business and improving the quality of his products.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase better manure for his banana gardens.

loans.name: Mauricio Javier

texts.es: Mauricio Javier tiene 42 años. Su actividad económica es la venta d plátanos. Hace más de 2 años que se dedica este negocio. Por lo que esta es la primera experiencia con créditos, se encuentra muy contento con aprender de esta experiencia. Inicio desde muy joven con este negocio pues su familia necesitaba de ingresos para mejorar su condición familiar. Mauricio siempre ha sido un hombre muy responsable, y le ha gustado ganarse el dinero de una manera muy decente y trabajadora.  El sueña con aumentar su negocio. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima necesaria ya que tiene muchos pedidos.
texts.en:
Mauricio Javier is 42 years old.  His business is selling bananas.  He has been in this business for more than 2 years.  This is his first experience with loans.  He is very happy to learn from the experience.

Mauricio started in this business at a very young age because his family needed income to improve their status.  Mauricio has always been a very responsible man and he has enjoyed earning his money in a very honorable and hard-working way.  He dreams of increasing his business and will use this loan to buy the raw materials that he needs since he has a lot of orders.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mujeres Poderosas 3 Group

texts.es:
Ysabel es la coordinadora del grupo Mujeres poderosas 3, cada uno de ellos días a días realizan sus actividades de negocios en la ciudad de Puerto Plata, una ciudad cuya actividades principales es el turismo y una fabrica de ron, tambien esta ciudad es fuerte en el sector inmobiliario, son las principales fuentes de trabajo. Se dedican mayormente a la venta de Joyas, Ropa, Calzados, Accesorios, cosméticos, alimentos, entre otros productos misceláneos.

Ysabel posee una familia conformada por su esposo y un hijo. Como madre nos dice que su mayor dificultad es salir a trabajar y tener que dejar a su hijo, solo sin su atencion, por eso es que esta dedicada a un negocio propio que le permita estas mas horas disponibles en su casa, atendiendo a su niño. Su actividad favorita es asistir a la iglesia y compartir con los miembros.

Ysabel opera la venta de Calzados y Joyerias, vio la necesidad de alguien que vendiera prendas de plata en su comunidad y otras cercanas, y comenzo a venderlas poco a poco, en la actualidad despues de cinco prestamo con Esperanza, ha podido dedicarse tambien a la venta de calzados. Este prestamo sera invertido en ambos productos dedicando el 50% de su prestamo a cada uno. Desea tener un negocio estable, con local y que pueda ser sostenible, y esta dentro de sus planes futuro poder construir este local al igual que su vivienda. Gracias por todo.
texts.en:
Ysabel is the coordinator of the 'Mujeres Poderosas 3' (Powerful Women 3) group.  Each of the group's members carries out her own business activity every day in the city of Puerto Plata.  This is a city whose main businesses are tourism and a rum factory.  The property sector is also strong in this city.  These are the main sources of work.  The ladies in this group mainly sell jewelry, clothes, shoes, accessories, cosmetics, food and other miscellaneous products.

Ysabel's family is made up of herself, her husband and her son.  As a mother, she tells us that her greatest difficulty is going out to work and having to leave her son at home alone without her attention.  For this reason, she works in her own business which allows her to spend more time at home looking after her son.  Ysabel's favorite activity is going to church and sharing with her fellow group members.

Ysabel runs a business selling shoes and jewelry.  She saw the need for someone to sell gold jewelry in her community and other nearby communities and she started selling these products gradually.  After having received five loans from Esperanza she is now able to sell shoes as well.  Ysabel will invest this loan in both lines of products, devoting 50% of her loan to each.  She would like to have a stable business, with her own premises, and for it to be sustainable.  One of her future plans is to build these premises as well as her own home.  Thank you for everything.

loans.use: To buy jewelry and shoes

loans.name: María

texts.es: María, de 46 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y alegre, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Desde muy pequeña siempre le enseñaron a María a trabajar en todo para alcanzar sus metas, ahora se dedica a la venta de alfalfa y cuyes, los cuales ella misma cultiva y cría respectivamente. Paralelamente trabaja junto a su hermana en la elaboración de quesos y manjar, productos que son vendidos en la ciudad de Lima. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es criar sus cuyes y lo hace con mucho amor, lleva 16 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que viajar constantemente a la ciudad de Lima, por los pedidos de manjar y queso que tiene. Con el tiempo, espera que su negocio siga creciendo  y que le pueda brindar mejores ingresos económicos. Este es el décimo segundo crédito con MFP, está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no desea meter en problemas a su banco comunal, en donde es muy solidaria con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los dos mil ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más comida para sus cuyes, ya que es la actividad que mejores ingresos le está generando.
texts.en:
46 year-old María is a very simple and cheerful woman.  She lives in her own home and what she most desires is to improve her quality of life.

Since she was a little girl, María has been taught to work hard at everything in order to achieve her goals.  Her business is selling alfalfa and guinea pigs that she grows and raises herself.  In parallel with this, she also works together with her sister making cheese and 'manjar' (a sweetened condensed milk product).  They sell these products in the city of Lima.

What Maria most likes about her work is raising her guinea pigs and she does this with a lot of love.  She has been in this business for 16 years and she considers that the most difficult part of her work is having to constantly travel to Lima with her 'manjar' and cheese orders.  Over time, María hopes that her business will continue to grow and that it will make her better profits.

This is María's 12th loan with MFP and she is ready to make all her repayments on time since she doesn't want to make difficulties for her community bank.  María is very supportive of the other members of her bank.  She will use the 2,800 Peruvian soles she is requesting to buy more feed for her guinea pigs since this is the business that is making her the best profits.

loans.use: To buy alfalfa and other feed for her guinea pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase high grade manure for her banana gardens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Hugo Cesar

texts.es:
Hugo es un padre de familia de 35 años de edad, que reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Catacaos, un lugar donde los alrededores son de viviendas de material rustico, además es  una zona turística que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

El tiene un Bar Picantería donde  ofrece la venta de comida, piqueos, bebidas como cerveza y chicha, esta actividad la realiza hace 4 años,  en su  domicilio Ampliación José Cayetano Heredia – Catacaos,  conoce a la perfección el rubro. El negocio goza de muy buena acogida por parte de sus clientes debido a la buena sazón con la que prepara su comida. 

Hugo desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de materiales para mejorar su negocio como: mesas sillas, etc. También realizar algunos cambios en su vivienda. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Hugo is a 35 year old father.  He lives with his wife and their two children in the Catacaos district.  It is a place where the surrounding areas are comprised of houses made from austere materials.  It is also a tourist zone, which is located in the Piura province in the region with the same name.  It is over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

He has a pub where he sells meals, appetizers, and drinks like beer and “chicha” (chicha de jora is an ancestral Peruvian and American beverage made from jora, fermented corn).  He has been doing this for four years in his home, which is in Ampliación José Cayetano Heredia – Catacaos.  He knows this line of work to perfection.  The business is very well received by his customers because of the good seasoning with which he prepares his food.

Hugo wishes to expand his business by purchasing materials to improve his business.   He will buy things like tables, and chairs, etc.  He also wants to make some changes to his home.  That is why he believes it is advisable to request a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy chairs, tables, and other materials to expand his business

loans.name: Hycenthe

texts.en: Hycenthe is 31 years old, and she has 4 children who are between the ages of 2 and 11. She sells men's and women's trousers, skirts, and shirts, and has done this business for 4 years. Hycenthe is requesting a loan in order to reinvest in her business by buying additional inventory of clothes. With the profits she plans to add to her savings and buy a car.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, D. 50 años, es una madre soltera muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en la casa D. su madre Doña Cirila D. 76 años, tiene 5 hijos pero actualmente solo vive con 3, sus otros dos hijos ya tiene familia y se mantienen por si solos. Todos los días Nelly sale junto a su inseparable carretilla a vender sus deliciosas golosinas, ella se ubica en las puertas del colegio “Santa Tereza” D. la ciudad D. Tarma, donD. tiene muchos clientes, es una vendedora muy persuasiva y siempre convence a sus clientes D. comprar más D. lo que tenían que comprar. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas D. venta, lleva 9 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer bajo el inclemente sol todos los días. Para el futuro, espera juntar más dinero para poner una tienda D. abarrotes donD. pueda atender a sus clientes con más tranquilidad. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que cumplir con los pagos D. todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria. Con los seiscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más golosinas para implementar mejor su negocio.
texts.en: Nelly, age 50, is a very loving and hard-working single mother.  She lives in the house of her mother, Doña Cirila, age 76.  She has 5 children, but at present only 3 live with her.  Her other two children already have their own family and live on their own.  Every day Nelly leaves along with her inseparable cart to sell her delicious snacks.  She sells by the doors of the “Santa Tereza” school of the city of Tarma, where she has many clients.  She is a very persuasive saleswoman and always convinces her clients to buy more than they have to buy.  What she likes most about her work is to converse with her neighboring salespeople. She has been doing this activity for 9 years and considers the most difficult aspect of the work is to have to remain under the hot sun every day.  For the future, she hopes to save more money to open a convenience store where she can attend to her clients with more tranquility.  This it is her ninth loan with MFP.  She understands that she has to make all her payments on time.  She is a supportive and very happy associate of her communal bank.  With the six hundred new soles she requests, she will buy more snacks in order to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more snacks to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Marie Claudette

texts.en:
Marie Claudette is 32 years old and she has 4 children who are between the ages of 4 to 13. All her children are in school, while her husband is an electrician.

Marie Claudette sells beef and she has done this business for 10 years. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more cattle for beef. She hopes to reinvest the profits in her business.

loans.use: To buy cattle for beef.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en: Cecile is 27 years old, and she is single. She has been a tailor for the past three years. Cecile is requesting a loan in order to buy more fabric and other tailoring equipment. With the profits she hopes to buy a phone which she hopes to use for business.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Juan Isidro

texts.es: Juan Isidro tiene 51 años, es un hombre casado. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo ellos estudian y ayudan a Juan. La actividad económica es la venta y destace de cerdo, hace más de 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Inicio este negocio por su familia, ya que fueron ellos quienes le enseñaron este negocio a Juan le gusta mucho ya que siempre estaba interactuando con sus clientes. El es un hombre trabajador y le gusta enseñarles a sus hijos como se gana el dinero humildemente fue con el tiempo decide hacerse cargo de manera independiente de este negocio ahora es la fuente principal de sus ingresos. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra materia prima para su negocio. El sueño de Juan es seguir adelante a pesar de todas las dificultades.
texts.en: Juan Isidro is 51 years of age and married.  He has 2 children in his care, who are students and help him.  His economic activity is the sale and raising of hogs.  He has been dedicated to this activity for more than 6 years.  He began this business with his family, since they were the ones who taught the business to Juan.  He enjoys it a lot because he is always interacting with his clients.  He is an industrious man and likes to teach his children as he humbly earns money.  With time he decided to take charge of his business independentsly and now it is the main source of his income.  The money that he requests is for working capital for the purchase commodities for his business.  Juan's dream is to continue ahead in spite of all the difficulties.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his hog-raising business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca, con el dinero del préstamo cancelara los uniformes escolares de sus hijos, La señora es secretaria en el Estadium Bolívar; esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención.

Francisca vive en casa de sus suegros ubicada en la zona Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz. Está casada y tiene dos hijos. Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
With the money from the loan, Señora Francisca will pay for the school uniforms for her children.  The lady is a secretary in the Bolivar stadium.  This activity is her principal source of income for her maintenance.  

Francisca lives at the home of her in-laws located in the Tembladerani zone of the City of La Paz.  She is married and has two children.  This is the third time that she has requested a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: To buy school uniforms for her two children

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es: Sarita, de 50 años, es una mujer que siempre ha trabajo muy duro por sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Hugo de 51 años y sus 4 hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. El trabajo que realiza Sarita es el cultivo de zanahorias, papa y arveja, esta labor la realiza junto a su esposo, quien también trabaja arduamente para brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos. Ella ha visto por conveniente llevar sus productos hasta el país de Bolivia, ya que según manifiesta, es ahí donde mejores ganancias obtiene. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden amenazar su productividad, lleva 16 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que el camino es muy largo y agotador. Con el tiempo, espera que sus cultivos mejoren y que su venta pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el décimo primer crédito con MFP, se siente en la obligación de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para sus cultivos y contratará un jornalero para que le ayude a sembrar.
texts.en: Sarita, age 50, is a woman who has always worked very hard to get ahead in life.  She lives in her own home along with her husband, Hugo, age 51, and their 4 children, who are the motive for all her efforts. The work that Sarita does is the cultivation of carrots, potatoes and peas.  She carries out this work along with her husband, who also works arduously to offer a good education to their children.  She has found it convenient to carry her products to the country of Bolivia, since she states, that is where she obtains better profits.  What she likes most about her work is to protect her crops from the pests that can threaten their productivity.  She has carried out this activity for 16 years and considers the most difficult aspect of the work is to transport her products, since the road is very long and exhausting.  With time, she hopes that her cultivations will improve and that her sales can improve their economic circumstances.  This it is her eleventh loan with MFP.  She understands the obligation to make all her payments promptly, since she does not want to cause problems to the associates of her communal bank, where she is very well liked.  With the two thousand five hundred new soles she requests, she will buy more fertilizer for her cultivations and will hire a workman to help her to sow.

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizer and to hire a workman to help her with the sowing.

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
El  señor Genaro, es comunicador y también trabaja como chofer; el crédito lo requiere para continuar los estudios universitarios como comunicador social.

Genaro es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres la cual esta ubicada en la zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito de IMPRO y la primera que es canalizada a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Señor Genaro, is in communication and also works as a chauffer.  He needs a loan to continue his studies in the university in social communication. 

Genaro is single and has no children.  He lives in the house of his parents, which is located in the Tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz. This is the second loan that he has requested from IMPRO and the first channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: to continue his studies for a degree in the science of communication

loans.name: Jeanette De Los Angeles

texts.es: Jeanette De Los Ángeles tiene 41 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de cosméticos. Hace más de 16 años que tiene este negocio, inicio con la ayuda de su familia y por la necesidad de obtener un medio de ingreso necesario tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Ella sale todos los días a ofrecer sus productos, ya que la mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan una gran variedad de materia prima. Jeanette se encuentra muy contenta con este medio de vida y con interactuar con sus clientes y así saber lo que ellos solicitan. El financiamiento es para la compra de lápiz labial, polvos, cremas, tratamientos entre otros.
texts.en: Jeanette is 41 years old and makes her living selling cosmetics. She has been doing this for 16 years and started the business with the help of her family so that she could have an income to care for her 3 children. She goes out to sell her products every day, and most of her clients ask her for a great variety of goods. Jeanette is very happy with this way of life and enjoys interacting with her clients and knowing what sorts of things they will ask her for. The loan is for buying lipstick, powders, creams, treatments, and other products.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Esperanza En Paraiso 1 & 2 Group

texts.es:
María es la coordinadora del grupo Esperanza en el paraíso, localizado en la ciudad de Puerto Plata, una ciudad cuya actividades principales es el turismo y una fabrica de ron, también esta ciudad es fuerte en el sector inmobiliario, son las principales fuentes de trabajo. Se dedican mayormente a la venta de Joyas, Ropa, Calzados, Accesorios, cosméticos, alimentos, entre otros productos misceláneos.

María posee una familia conformada por su pareja sentimental y 5 descendientes, entre ellos hijos y familiares. Nos cuenta que siempre ha sido una mujer trabajadora, y siempre ha buscado la manera de tener diferentes negocios, por ejemplo actualmente posee un colmado el cual inicio hace ya unos 2 años y medio, después de haber iniciado a vender ropa interiores, y con las ganancias, las cuales fue ahorrando pudo comenzar su tienda de comestibles, lo que en Republica Dominicana llamamos colmado. Al recibir este segunda préstamo, sus planes son invertirlo en diferentes mercancías como arroz, habichuela, productos enlatados, botanas, azúcar, entre otros productos de consumo diario. 

Sus retos son poder lograr sus sueños de tener un colmado grande o un súper mercado, y que tanto sus hijos como su familia pueda trabajar en el negocio de la familia. Tener una buena estabilidad económica, y tranquilidad. Desea tener la oportunidad de ayudar a su comunidad y proveer a sus hijos sus necesidades de alimentación, vestimenta y educación.
texts.en:
María is the “Esperanza en el Paraíso” (Hope in Paradise) group coordinator.  It is located in the city of Puerto Plata, a city whose main activities are tourism and a rum distillery; real estate is also strong in this city.  These are the main sources of employment.  The group is mostly involved in sales of jewelry, clothing, shoes, accessories, cosmetics and food, among other miscellaneous products.

María’s family is composed of her spouse and five family members, children and relatives among them.  She tells us that she’s always been a hard working woman and has always sought to have various businesses.  For example, she currently has a grocery store that she started about two years ago after having started out in underwear sales; she used profits she gradually saved to start a grocery store, which in the Dominican Republic are called “colmado.” Upon receiving this second loan she plans to use it to buy several products like: rice, beans, canned goods, snacks and sugar, among other daily use items.

Her challenges are to reach her dreams of having a large grocery store or a supermarket so that both her children and family can work in the family business, to have good economic stability and peace of mind.  She wants to have the opportunity of helping her community and provide her children with the basic needs of food, clothing and education.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
La señora Pascuala es productora lechera y los días de feria se dedica a vender buzos deportivos que su esposo los confecciona; con el dinero del préstamo la señora aumentara más ganado lechero, pues intenta comprar una vaca lechera de buena calidad.

Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Achacachi del departamento de La Paz . Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.

Pascuaza está casada y tiene un hijo.
texts.en:
Pascuala is a milk producer and on market days she sells tracksuits that her husband makes.  She will use her loan money to increase her dairy herd, buying a good-quality dairy cow.

Pascuala lives in her own home which is located in the town of Achacachi, in La Paz department.  This is the first time that she has worked with Impro and Kiva.  She is married and has one child.

loans.use: To buy a good-quality dairy cow to increase her milk sales volume

loans.name: Deggo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité DEGGO est créé 05 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 32 femmes issues du même quartier. Elles ont formé leur groupe par voisinage et par affinité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de NOB SA JËKËR.

Madame NDEYE MADY FANTA D. debout à tout à fait à droite de la photo et mise en médaillon est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle a aussi la charge de son neveux 

Elle fait un petit commerce. Elle vend des produits cosmétiques, des vêtements, de l'huile d epalme etc. Elle pratique cette activité depuis son bas âge.

Son crédit lui permettra de renforcer son activité afin d'escompter des bénéfices plus importants. 

Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge financière de la famille tout renforçant son niveau d'épargne au niveau du Banc villageois
texts.en:
The DEGGO solidarity group was created on December 5, 2007. It is composed of 32 women from the same neighborhood. They came together as neighbors and by affinity. The group is part of the Banc Villageois NOB SA JËKËR.

Mrs. NDEYE MADY FANTA D., standing at the far right of the photo and shown inset, is the head of the group. She is 36 years old, married and the mother of four dependent children. She also has a nephew in her care.

She has a small business selling cosmetic products, clothes, palm oil, etc. She started practicing this activity at an early age. Her loan will allow her to strengthen her business and bolster her profits.

Her goal is to help support the family financially while increasing her savings with the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
Nelson desempeña las funciones de Montanista en una imprenta ya que el señor es grafico; con el dinero del préstamo podrá cubrir los gastos de matricula y el pago de mensualidades, pues está estudiando diseño gráfico. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención.

Nelson es soltero y vive en casa en la casa de sus padres en la zona de la Villa Bolívar D Ciudad de El Alto.
texts.en:
Nelson works as an editor in a printer's.  He is a graphic designer.  He will use his loan money to cover his registration fees and his monthly tuition fees since he is studying graphic design. This is his main source of income through which he supports himself.

Nelson is single and lives in his parents' home in Villa Bolívar D district, in the city of El Alto.

loans.use: To cover his registration fees and his monthly tuition fees so that he can study graphic design

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raúl se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir y con el dinero del préstamo podrá adquirir una maquina de coser recta para ampliar el pequeño taller de costura que tiene.

Raul vive en casa de sus padres  en la Ciudad de El Alto, está divorciado y tiene tres hijos bajo su tutela. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y Kiva.
texts.en:
Raúl makes clothes and will use his loan money to acquire a sewing machine to expand the small sewing workshop that he owns.

Raúl lives in his parents' home in the city of El Alto.  He is divorced and has responsibility for three children.  This is the first time that he has worked with Impro and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for his sewing workshop

loans.name: Magda Emelina

texts.es: La señora Magda Emelina se dedica a una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Pues siempre está buscando la forma de generar ingresos para su familia. Realiza sus compras de contado en los diferentes mercados pues tiene que buscar en donde encuentra los productos más favorables y a camiones repartidores.  Esta solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio, para la compra de golosinas, refrescos y jugos  el cual está generando ingresos favorables, la señora vive de manera moderada  y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos.
texts.en:
Magda Emelina has a grocery store in her house.  She has always looked for ways to generate income for her family.  She buys merchandise in various markets and from delivery trucks because she has find the best products; she pays cash.

She is asking for a new loan to invest in the business, which is generating favorable income, buying snacks, soft drinks and juices.  She lives a moderate life style and has all basic utilities.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Silvia Lorena

texts.es:
La señora C. tiene una pulpería en su casa con más de 10 años de experiencia en esta actividad
Este crédito será utilizado para mejorar su vivienda que es donde tiene el negocio
Este negocio lo comenzó con esfuerzo propio y poco a poco ha logrado salir adelante ya que los productos que vende son granos básicos que son de primera necesidad
Con este préstamo ella lo que quiere es ampliar mas en área donde está la pulpería 
Este es el segundo crédito que trabaja con nuestra institución
texts.en: Ms. C. has a pulpería [small grocery store] in her house. She has more than 10 years of experience running her business. She will use this loan to make improvements to her house, which is also where she runs her business. She started this business through her own effort, and little by little, she has progressed forward. She sells products like basic grains, which are a staple item. She will use this loan to expand the area where she has her pulpería. This is her second loan through CEPRODEL.

loans.use: to expand the area in her home where she runs her store; to buy corrugated metal sheets, stones, and cement

loans.name: Yessenia Yadira

texts.es:
Yessenia, tiene de la edad de 26 años, es soltera, estilista, habita en Juigalpa. Es una persona trabajadora  a pesar de ser joven piensa en su futuro, es dedicada a su trabajo el que desempeña con dedicacion y esmero, lucha por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y ayudar a su mama que le acompaña en su casa de habitacion.  

Solicita el apoyo de Kiva para con este credito poder mejora sus Vivienda, como es cambiarle  parte del techo, mejorar puertas y ventanas.  
Sueña con llegar a tener todas las condiciones en su Vivienda y ser una persona profesional.
texts.en:
Yessenia, 26, is single, works as a stylist, and lives in Juigalpa. She is a hard-working person who, despite her young age, thinks about the future. She is dedicated to her work, which she performs with great care, and she fights to improve her living conditions and to help her mother, with whom she lives.

She is requesting support through Kiva so that she can use this loan to make improvements to her house, specifically to replace the roof and to improve the doors and windows.

She dreams of having a fully-equipped house and of being a professional.

loans.use: home improvements (to replace her roof and repair a window)

loans.name: Liana Del Carmen

texts.es: Liana Del Carmen se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio. Ella ha puesto mucho empeño por mejorar su negocio, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para su negocio. Ella se levanta temprano para alistar su bolso en donde prepara todos los productos que le mostrara a sus diferentes clientes, por lo que siempre está pendiente de lo que ellos le solicitan. Es por este motivo que solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima como bolsos, calzado, cosméticos, entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Liana Del Carmen sells general merchandise; she’s had this business for over four years.  She has put a lot of effort into improving her business so this isn’t her first loan for it.

She rises very early to organize her bundle where she puts all the products she will show to various customers; she is always on the lookout for what they request.

Because of this she’s asking for this loan to buy merchandise like: purses, shoes and cosmetics, among other items.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of oil.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: La señora Rosa Argentina tiene 66 años. Su actividad es la venta de panadería. Inicio con pocos productos pero ha sido con el paso del tiempo que ha logrado mejorar su negocio, se levanta temprano desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche que regresa a su hogar pues ha demostrado ser una persona muy luchadora.  Este es su segundo crédito con Fundación que ha obtenido con mucho sacrificio, con este crédito quiere comprar productos como mantequilla, huevo, harina, queso entre otros. Por lo que sueña con seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa Argentina, 66, has a bakery.  She started out with just a few products and as time has passed has been able to improve her business.  She rises early at 5am and doesn’t get back home until 9 at night; she is a very hard working, tenacious woman.

This is her second Fundación loan that she has gotten with much sacrifice.  She wants to use the loan to buy products like butter, eggs, flour and cheese, among others.  She dreams with continuing to invest in her business and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Fanny Derling

texts.es:
Fanny es una madre D. familia D. 35 años D. edad. ResiD. junto a su esposo y su hijo en una casa. Viven en la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque, caracterizado principalmente por ser una zona comercial.

DesD. hace ocho años, se dedica a la venta D. ropa para niños. Ella venD. sus productos por catálogo a su familia, amigos y vecinos. También venD. su ropa a algunos comerciantes minoristas que recorren diversos puntos D. la ciudad. Este negocio es una fuente importante D. ingreso a la economía D. su familia.

En Perú, se avecina la temporada escolar y ya ha comenzado a aumentar la demanda para la ropa D. Fanny. Para satisfacer esta demanda, Fanny desea ampliar su negocio y adquirir más mercaderías. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo D. 2,000 nuevos soles.

Fanny es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable. Ella ha mostrado una gran capacidad D. gestión en su negocio y tiene muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. Se encuentra agradecido con las personas que colaboraron con ella a través del programa Kiva. Su mayor anhelo sigue siendo sacar adelante a su familia y mejorar su calidad D. vida, por ello siempre se esfuerza al máximo en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Fanny, 35, is a mother living with her husband and son in a house.  They live in the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital, characterized primarily for being a commercial zone.

She has sold children’s clothes for the last 8 years.  She sells her items via catalogue to her family, friends and neighbors.  She also sells her clothes to some retailers who travel around the city.  This business is an important source of family income.

The new school term is approaching in Perú and demand for Fanny’s clothing is already increasing.  To meet this demand, Fanny wants to expand her business acquiring more merchandise.  Because of this she has deemed it advisable to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan.

Fanny is a responsible, very hard working woman.  She has shown a great capacity for running her business and has good personal and work-related references.  She is grateful to the people who collaborate with her through the Kiva program.  Her greatest wish is to continue supporting her family and improving their quality of life.  Because of this she always puts the maximum effort into her work.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Yamilett Del Socorro

texts.es: Yamilett Del Socorro tiene 22 años, su actividad económica es la venta de comida. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar desde muy joven. Cuando inicio fue por los conocimientos de su Mama así fue que ella logro aprender lo necesario y adquirir experiencia para fortalecer su trabajo, pues ella siempre sea preocupado por su familia como son sus 2 hijos que les proporciona el alimento diario y además mejorar su condición de vida. El financiamiento que actualmente solicita es para la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, frutas y verduras. Su deseo es poder proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en: Yamilett Del Socorro is 22 years old; her economic activity is food sales.  She’s been in this business for over 5 years; she has enjoyed working since she was very young.  When she started out it was thanks to her mother’s knowledge; this was how she gradually acquired the necessary skills and experience to be better at her work.  She has always cared for her family, which are two children, providing their daily food and improving their living conditions.  The loan she’s asking for on this occasion is to buy rice, beans, fruit and vegetables.  Her wish is to be able to do some home improvements.

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda tiene 34 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos, vive en la ciudad de Pisaq de la provincia del Calca departamento del Cusco, Perú.
 
Leonarda nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de artesanía de tipo bisutería, ella tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde elabora la artesanía.
